content.text: In the expansion of \(\left(x^{2} - \frac{a}{x}\right)^{7}\), the coefficient of \(x^{5}\) is \(-280\). Find the value of the constant \(a\).
f \(^{-1}(x)\) in the form \(ax^{2} + bx + c\) , where \(a\) , \(b\) and \(c\) are constants,
the domain of \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\)
A function f is such that \(\operatorname {f}(x) = \sqrt{\left(\frac{x + 3}{2}\right)} + 1\) , for \(x \geqslant -3\) . Find
Show that the area, \(A \mathrm{m}^2\) , of the playground is given by
Given that \(x\) can vary, find the minimum area of the playground

The diagram shows a plan for a rectangular park \(ABCD\) , in which \(AB = 40 \mathrm{m}\) and \(AD = 60 \mathrm{m}\) . Points \(X\) and \(Y\) lie on \(BC\) and \(CD\) respectively and \(AX\) , \(XY\) and \(YA\) are paths that surround a triangular playground. The length of \(DY\) is \(x \mathrm{m}\) and the length of \(XC\) is \(2x \mathrm{m}\)
the value of \(k\) ,
the coordinates of \(P\)
The line \(y = \frac{x}{k} + k\) , where \(k\) is a constant, is a tangent to the curve \(4y = x^{2}\) at the point \(P\). Find
the equation of \(BC\),
the coordinates of \(C\)
The diagram shows a triangle \(ABC\) in which \(A\) has coordinates (1, 3), \(B\) has coordinates (5, 11) and angle \(ABC\) is \(90^\circ\). The point \(X\) (4, 4) lies on \(AC\). Find
Solve the equation \(2\cos 2y = 3\tan 2y,\) for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant y\leqslant 180^{\circ}.\)
In the case where \(k = 2\), calculate angle \(AOB\)
Find the values of \(k\) for which \(\overrightarrow{AB}\) is a unit vector
The position vectors of the points \(A\) and \(B\), relative to an origin \(O\), are given by
where \(k\) is a constant
the first term,
the sum to infinity of the progression
In a geometric progression, all the terms are positive, the second term is 24 and the fourth term is \(13\frac{1}{2}\). Find
A circle is divided into \(n\) sectors in such a way that the angles of the sectors are in arithmetic progression. The smallest two angles are \(3^{\circ}\) and \(5^{\circ}\). Find the value of \(n\)
[Questions 9, 10 and 11 are printed on the next page.]
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at \(A\)
Determine, showing all necessary working, whether \(C\) is nearer to \(B\) or to \(O\)
Find, showing all necessary working, the exact volume obtained when the shaded region is rotated through \(360^{\circ}\) about the \(x\)-axis

The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = \frac{9}{2x + 3}\) , crossing the \(y\)-axis at the point \(B(0, 3)\). The point \(A\) on the curve has coordinates (3, 1) and the tangent to the curve at \(A\) crosses the \(y\)-axis at \(C\)
Find the equation of the curve
Show that the gradient of the curve has a minimum value when \(x = 2\) and state this minimum value
A curve is defined for \(x > 0\) and is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = x + \frac{4}{x^2}\) . The point \(P(4, 8)\) lies on the curve
Show that \(x = 7.218\) , correct to 3 decimal places
Find the total area of the three parts of the sector lying outside the circle with centre \(C\)

The diagram shows a sector of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(20\mathrm{cm}\) . A circle with centre \(C\) and radius \(x\mathrm{cm}\) lies within the sector and touches it at \(P\) , \(Q\) and \(R\) . Angle \(POR = 1.2\) radians
